If the person does not respond to adequate dose and duration of more than one antipsychotic medication, using one medicine at a time, then antipsychotic combination treatment may be considered; preferably under the supervision of a specialist, with close clinical monitoring. Consider consultation with a specialist for the use of clozapine in those who have not responded to other antipsychotic medications at adequate doses and durations. Only use clozapine under the supervision of a specialist and only if routine laboratory monitoring is available, due to the risk of life-threatening agranulocytosis.
